JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Khanlar Hajiyev;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON Finozhenok , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . The respondent Government are represented by PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant ’s mother , PERSON , born in DATE , and brother , Mr PERSON GPE , born in DATE , lived in GPE , GPE .
In DATE ORG launched a counter - terrorist operation in GPE . The applicant lost contact with her relatives after DATE .
It appears that in DATE the applicant , who tried to obtain information about her relatives through the local police department , was informed by ORG that her relatives had died in ORG in DATE .

In DATE the head of the Oktyabrskiy district administration of ORG informed the applicant that her relatives had been killed on CARDINAL DATE as a result of a missile strike . The applicant was informed that the bodies of her relatives and of the third man who had died as a result of the same strike were buried in ORG in DATE by the relatives of that man .
In DATE a hospital in ORG issued death certificates in respect of PERSON and PERSON and indicated that the deaths had occurred on DATE as the result of a missile attack .

In DATE the applicant wrote to the prosecutor ’s office and informed them about her relatives’ deaths . She sought the prosecutor ’s assistance in obtaining the death certificates from ORG . It appears that in DATE ORG informed the applicant that they would examine her complaint about her relatives’ deaths and notify her of the results . They also sent her copies of the death certificates obtained in the hospital in PERSON ( see above ) .
On DATE ORG informed the applicant that ORG had been instructed to establish the circumstances of her relatives’ deaths .

On DATE the ORG , having conducted a check , decided not to open a criminal investigation into the applicant ’s relatives’ deaths . The investigator collected several statements and found it established that the house at CARDINAL FAC had burned down in DATE and that there had been no eyewitnesses to the deaths . He concluded that no crime had been committed . The information was sent to ORG office in DATE ; it is unclear whether the applicant was notified at that time .
It does not appear that after that date the applicant sought or received any information concerning the investigation from the prosecutor ’s office .
In DATE the applicant wrote to ORG and sought their assistance in obtaining death certificates from the civil register office .

On DATE the district court in the GPE region certified the applicant ’s relatives’ deaths . The court took into account the medical death certificates issued in DATE , the applicant ’s statements and other evidence . On DATE the district civil register office in the GPE region issued death certificates in relation of the applicant ’s mother and brother .
On DATE the Deputy Head of ORG wrote to the Head of ORG and to the applicant . According to him , a check had confirmed the applicant ’s relatives’ deaths on DATE during a missile strike .

On an unspecified date the applicant lodged an application with LOC , GPE to restore the time - limit for her to receive her inheritance . On CARDINAL DATE ORG granted the request . It held that the applicant was the sole heir of her mother and brother and extended the time - limit for her to receive her inheritance for DATE . It does not appear that the applicant has ever formally accepted the inheritance through the notary .

In DATE she wrote to ORG and asked whether the house situated at CARDINAL FAC had been included in the list of dwellings which had become uninhabitable as a result of the military campaign . It is unclear if she received any response .

The applicant then claimed compensation for the destroyed flat and other belongings under Government Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE ( see below ) . Within the same proceedings the applicant also claimed non - pecuniary damages for the suffering caused by her relatives’ deaths from ORG .

On DATE the ORG of GPE issued its judgment . The court held that the compensation constituted a personal entitlement payable to the residents of GPE who had lost their houses and other property , but not to their heirs . In any event , the applicant had not applied to the Commission set up to consider compensation claims . The court further observed that the right to sue for compensation in respect of non - pecuniary damage inflicted to life or health was not heritable . The court reiterated that the applicant ’s claim for non - pecuniary damages could not be directed against the Government , in the absence of a proven causal link between the actions of the Government and the damage claimed . It dismissed the applicant ’s claims . It stressed that she was still able to bring a tort action against the State . On DATE ORG upheld that judgment .

In DATE the applicant attempted to sue ORG for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages caused by the actions of ORG agents . On DATE ORG , as the final level of jurisdiction , refused to accept the claim , for lack of territorial jurisdiction . On DATE ORG in GPE refused to consider a similar claim , for lack of substantiating documents and failure to pay a reduced court fee of MONEY ( RUB ) . The applicant did not appeal .
The ORG submitted CARDINAL pages from the criminal investigation file opened into the deaths of PERSON and PERSON . These documents can be summarised as follows .

Following the communication of the applicant ’s complaint to the Government , on DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE not to open a criminal investigation . On DATE ORG of ORG decided to open a criminal investigation into the applicants’ relatives’ deaths . The applicant was informed DATE .
In DATE the applicant was questioned and granted victim status in the proceedings .

The investigators identified and questioned several neighbours and other witnesses , including the relatives of the third person who had died on DATE , together with the applicants’ relatives . They also examined the site of the house and found some metal objects there , which were identified by an expert report as parts of a mine . They sought information from various military and other agencies about the location and actions of military units in DATE , but it does not appear that anything of relevance was obtained . On DATE the investigation was adjourned for failure to identify the culprits ; the applicant was informed on DATE but did not appeal against that decision . It appears that on CARDINAL DATE the investigation was reopened , of which the applicant was informed .
LAW provides as following :
“ LAW . Judicial examination of complaints

CARDINAL . Decisions of an investigator or prosecutor concerning their refusal to initiate a criminal investigation ... or any other decisions and acts or omissions which are liable to infringe the constitutional rights and freedoms of the parties to criminal proceedings or to impede ORG access to justice , may be appealed against to a district court , which is empowered to examine the lawfulness and grounds of the impugned decisions ....
CARDINAL . The court examines the lawfulness and the grounds for the impugned decisions or acts ... within DATE from the receipt of the complaint ...
CARDINAL . As a result of the examination of the complaint the court delivers CARDINAL of the following decisions :
CARDINAL ) Declaring the decisions , acts or omissions of the official unlawful or unsubstantiated and obliging the official to eliminate the defects ;
CARDINAL ) Not allowing the applicant ’s complaint ... ”

The Government decree no . CARDINAL of DATE on payment of compensation for lost housing and possessions to citizens affected as a result of the resolution of a crisis in GPE and residing permanently in the region ( as in force at the relevant time ) , provided that persons who lived permanently in GPE had the right to compensation for lost housing and property . It established a Commission which was entitled to consider such claims .
